alert.note: Alert for Avery; Burke Mountains; Caldwell Mountains; Eastern McDowell; Greater Burke; Greater Caldwell; McDowell Mountains; Mitchell; Yancey (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 3:16AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A CLUSTER OF THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT MCDOWELL...MITCHELL... CALDWELL...AVERY...EASTERN YANCEY AND NORTHWESTERN BURKE COUNTIES UNTIL 345 AM EDT... At 316 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated the leading edge of a cluster of thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles south of Deep Gap to 11 miles south of Blowing Rock to 9 miles southwest of Spruce Pine to 12 miles southwest of Marion, and moving north at 15 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Lenoir, Marion, Spruce Pine, Newland, Gamewell, Old Fort, Banner Elk, Elk Park, Bakersville and Beech Mountain In Avery County. Very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters.

area.areaDesc: Avery; Burke Mountains; Caldwell Mountains; Eastern McDowell; Greater Burke; Greater Caldwell; McDowell Mountains; Mitchell; Yancey
